Description: Figure of Hathor, arms by her sides and the hair arranged in Isis-locks. She wears an enormous headdress, incorporating a succession of bound wreaths, from which floral elements and wide ribbons hang beside her arms. She is adorned with a necklace with a pendant, armlets, bracelets and anklets. Back plain; circular vent. Hollow; two-piece mould made of brown Nile silt with a little mica. The figure has been dipped face down in a white dressing, leaving the back free. There are orange-red paint traces on the headdress and its pendent florals. According to the excavator, the anklets were gilded when found.
Curator's comments: Petrie, Tanis I, 42, frontispiece (No.11) See Brissaud and Zivie-Coche - Tanis 1987-1997, (1998) p.126, 159, 175 [pls.23, 29].

Terracotta IV Donated: Egypt Exploration Fund. Tanis: Find 35, the House of Bakhakhuiu, now read as Ashaikhet (Petrie 1885: 41-6). Ibid.: 41: 'On the eastern side of the great temple of San…' (presumably outside the great enclosure wall shown, ibid.: pl. [xvii]) '…a road leads out between the high mounds of houses which encircle it.' On this road are House 35 and the 'adjacent' (ibid.: 38) House 44. But (ibid.: 46) he describes the position of House 44 as 'some yards to the east [of House 35] and beside the same roadway'. Perhaps as late as the second century AD (material of that date was found in the house, but there were also late Ptolemaic objects). Comparanda: Close: Hawass 2002: 85; Coincraft 1997: 9, no. EA799. Near: Brissaud 1994: 15, fig. 1a, from Tanis, in a Graeco-Roman context; Dunand 1979: no. 54; Fischer 1994: no. 811, dated second half of the first century AD = Vogt 1924: pl. xxx:4; Fjeldhagen 1995: no. 50, dated second half of the first century AD; Graindor 1939: pl. xiv:3; Legrain 1894: pl. xlii: lot 544. Bibliog. Petrie 1885: frontispiece:11, p. 42; Edwards 1892: 59; James 1982: 21, fig. 6; Nachtergael 1985: 232; Fischer 1994: 331: no. 810, 331-2: no. 813; Favard-Meeks 1998: 126, pls xxiii and xxixb.
Bibliographic references: Terracotta / Catalogue of Terracottas in the British Museum (3000)
